heisig_chinese_memo: Watch out or you could be a retained slave for the feudal official.
heisig_story: This kanji is actually a pictograph for an eye, distorted to make it appear that the pupil is protruding towards the right. This may not be an easy form to remember, but try this: Draw it once rather large, and notice how moving the two vertical lines on the right as far right as possible gives you the pictograph of the eye in its natural form. The "pop-eye" image belongs to an Emperor's retainer standing in awe before his ruler.
koohiiStory1: Its a pictograph of a teeth with a retainer in the middle.
koohiiStory2: Retainer = A slave (for the purposes of this kanji.) This is a pictograph of a slave collar with two handcuffs dangling from it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The servant radical and the servant kanji are exactly the same! Just remember that the kanji also means retainer and you‚Äôll be fine.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Retainer and servant are basically the same thing, so remembering this one shouldn‚Äôt be too hard for you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your servant, also known as your retainer, bangs his shins („Åó„Çì) all the time so you make him wear jeans („Åò„Çì) to work now. He bangs his shins on all the furniture in the house, knocking over all your valuables. But at least when he‚Äôs wearing jeans it doesn‚Äôt leave bruises like it did when he wasn‚Äôt wearing pants.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine your servant banging his shins on everything in your house. Hand him a pair of jeans and tell him to put them on to soften the blows.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: (looks like) the bricks in your wall = your subjects
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Watch out or you could be a retained slave for the feudal official.
humanum_full_description_en:
A bronze inscription to " mesh " the erection of shape, Elephant Man open his eyes, glare, in the middle of the eye-shaped large, protruding outside the orbit, is " aversion " of the word (Wu Qiuhui, Wangning Sheng), " Chen " is the original meaning of the word The scorn looked straight, and later referred to slaves, which was then extended to bureaucrats serving the monarch. Because the original meaning is gradually lost under the pretext of popularization, the pictophonetic character "Áûã" was created to represent the original meaning of " Chen ". See " Affliction ".

Oracle bone inscriptions, bronze inscriptions, or add some pens to the pupils of " Chen ". The characters of the Warring States Period may have a vertical pen in the middle penetrating the pupil, or a vertical pen superimposed on the pupil. Xiaozhuan did not inherit this form.

The word " Chen " in Jiajin inscription refers to slaves. For example, "Collection" 849 is: "Zhou Chen „û¢ (Êúâ) fled", referring to the escape of slaves in the state. "book. "Fee Oath": "The ministers and concubines flee." Kong Anguo Chuan: "The servants are inferior, the men are the ministers, and the women are the concubines." Ling Gui: "Jiang Shang (reward) orders Bei Shipeng, Chen Shijia", " Peng " is Bei's unit, the whole sentence refers to Jiang rewarded Lingshipengbei coins and ten servants.

In addition, the meaning of the word " chen " was extended from slave to surrender, and then to the minister of the king. Therefore, the word " Chen " can also refer to ministers and officials. For example, "Collection" 12: "The ministers order all the millets", which means that the ministers order the masses to farm. Zhongshan King Fanghu: "Said (soon) decides the position of the emperor and minister." In addition, the inscription " Chen " can be used as a clan name or a person's name.

"Said the text": "Chen, pull also. It is also the ruler. Like the form of surrender. All the subjects are subordinate to the subject." Press to " pull " to train " Chen " is the voice training.
humanum_short_description_en: A bronze inscription to " mesh " the erection of shape, Elephant Man open his eyes, glare, in the middle of the eye-shaped large, protruding outside the orbit, is " aversion this word (Wu Qiuhui, Wangning Sheng)" after the guise of slaves, courtiers .

minister
Basic explanation of words
minister
ch√©n
The officials in the age of the monarch sometimes also included the people: ministers. Courtier. Surrender. Monarch.
The official proclaimed to the monarch: "There will be no king, and the ministers are willing to be envoys."
The ancients called themselves modestly.
Ancient refers to male slaves: servants. Captain.
Jun
minister
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªch√©nÔºΩ
["Guangyun" planting neighbors, plain and true, Zen. ]
(1) Prisoners of war.
(2) Slaves, slaves.
(3) People under the jurisdiction of the monarch.
(4) Officials in the era of monarchy.
(5) The minister's claim to the emperor.
(6) The king's claim to his parents, ancestors, heaven and earth, etc.
(7) The ancients' self-proclaimed humbleness was mostly seen before the Qin and Han dynasties.
(8) It is also occasionally used to claim to be ridiculed.
(9) Generally refers to the assignment of things.
(10) Perform the duty of a minister.
(11) Regard it as a minister; serve as a minister.
(12) Use the same as "undertake". recognition.
(13) Last name. Tang Youchen Yue.

Radicals: Ëá£  (servant)
Meaning Mnemonic
The servant radical and the servant kanji are exactly the same! Just remember that the kanji also means retainer and you‚Äôll be fine.
Retainer and servant are basically the same thing, so remembering this one shouldn‚Äôt be too hard for you.
Reading Mnemonic
Your servant, also known as your retainer, bangs his shins („Åó„Çì) all the time so you make him wear jeans („Åò„Çì) to work now. He bangs his shins on all the furniture in the house, knocking over all your valuables. But at least when he‚Äôs wearing jeans it doesn‚Äôt leave bruises like it did when he wasn‚Äôt wearing pants.
Imagine your servant banging his shins on everything in your house. Hand him a pair of jeans and tell him to put them on to soften the blows.
